column4: hmm, theres an idea, a safe root login that stop you doing stupid things
rm -rf /  Not allowed please type another command
There is.  It's called normal user accounts.
yeah but you want to let them edit file but not delete whole system directories
Editing is deleting.
if you want, you can customize sudo to allow users to say, run nano, but not rm.
yes but normal people cant do this
eh?  Your administrator would have to set it up.
yes some 40 something mother with kids has an on hand admin
Oh.  You mean normal people can't set it up?  Right.  But normal people don't usually have to worry about multiple accounts and having to have a tiered permission system.
yes but normal people read howto and do typos thus wrecking the install
with the technically uninclined you cited, you wouldn't ever get them to figure out which hoops to jump through to remove the files they actually WANT to remove, if you disallowed that.
Im not saying they would intentionally do it, people make mistakes, especially those not familair with the system
disallowing them to rm / isn't a mistake most people make.  Except when stupid people try and trick them nito it.  Since most people don't ever rm any sstem files, just edit them.
Im just saying when in sudo that there should be a command filter (that can be disabled by the none newbies) that warns them they are about to self destruct the system
